page.title: 15Peak Forest Canal,Marple.
page.content: The Peak Forest Canal runs from two termini,Whaley Bridge and Buxworth through Furness Vale, New Mills and Disley to Marple,where it meets the Macclesfield Canal. It descends a flight of 16 locks falling 210 feet and crosses the River Goyt by means of a three arch stone aqueduct more than 100 feet high. The canal provides a busy leisure facility and most days,even in winter, narrow boats are seen following the Cheshire Ring. There are now narrow boats providing day trips as well as a boat that has been converted into a floating restaurant. After descent of the flight of locks the canal proceeds to Romiley, Hyde and Dukinfield and finally to a junction with the Ashton Canal.
